intro: Sinclairia polyantha, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Sinclairia polyantha blooms in late spring to early summer, adding ornamental value with its delicate, clustered flowers.
